articles.title: ‘Taxi Driver' scribe Paul Schrader has ‘perfect script' for AI feature film
articles.summary: Paul Schrader has the perfect script for the first AI feature film. He believes movies are going to be less two-dimensional and artificial intelligence will play a bigger role in movies in the future.    He doesn't think AI is a replacement for people.

articles.title: A peek into the 22nd century: Life in the age of AI and abundance
articles.author: ABcontributor
articles.summary: R.K. Pillai shares his vision of a post-scarcity society with AGI and ASI, surplus societies powered by AI and AI-driven automation, and a human consciousness enhanced by synthetic consciousness. He believes that by 2100 we could enter a post scarcity era, where abundance is material and existential.

articles.title: Elon Musk Says AI Will 'Likely' Be Good For Humanity—But Admits He'd Still Want To See It Even If It Turns Out Bad. 'I'd At Least Like To Be Alive To See It'
articles.author: Ivy Grace
articles.summary: Elon Musk thinks artificial intelligence will be good for humanity, but admits he would still like to see it happen even if it turns out bad. He once warned that AI is a "fundamental existential risk for human civilization" but now he seems to have made peace with it.

articles.title: AI Coding Revolution

They talk about the transformative role of AI in democratizing programming, technical breakthroughs in agentic AI, historical parallels in computing evolution, debates on AGI timelines, and economic implications.

articles.title: This Is Not a Browser—Did René Magritte Really Predict the End of the Web Age?
articles.author: Andrew Keen
articles.summary: OpenAI introduced their new Atlas browser this week. Keith Teare believes it's the end of the link architecture of the web and the rise of conversational agents that answer questions, summarize content, and even execute tasks like booking flights. The web's business model has been largely advertising-based, built on users clicking links that generate revenue. Publishers and content creators are the ones facing disruption, as AI may eliminate their distribution channels without providing alternatives for reaching audiences or monetizing content.

articles.title: 4 Ways Everybody Should Be Using AI To Grow Their Wealth in Late 2025

articles.summary: Experts say more people should be using artificial intelligence (AI) to grow their wealth. Here are some ways you can use AI to grow your wealth: Suggest investment strategies, improve your skills, identify new income streams and streamline your business.

articles.title: SoftBank approves remaining $22.5 billion of OpenAI investment, the Information reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: SoftBank has approved a second installment of $22.5 billion to complete its $30 billion investment in OpenAI. The money would fill out a $41 billion financing round that was announced in April. If OpenAI's restructuring fails, the investment amount would drop to $20 billion.

articles.title: Softbank approves remaining $22.5 billion of OpenAI investment, The Information reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Softbank has approved a second installment of $22.5 billion to complete its $30 billion investment in OpenAI. The board has approved the installment as long as the artificial intelligence startup completes a corporate restructuring that would pave the way for an eventual public offering.

Dubai Police operates a sophisticated drone fleet equipped with various sensors and cameras. It has dedicated cybercrime units focused on investigating and combating cyberattacks, online fraud, and digital evidence collection.

articles.title: Perry: How can AI be used ethically when it's been linked to suicide?
articles.author: David M. Perry
articles.summary: According to a recent lawsuit, a 16-year-old boy named Adam Raine turned to OpenAI's ChatGPT for assistance when struggling with mental health. Adam's parents found him hanging in the closet in April. Two researchers at Northeastern University have found that multiple chatbots can be led into assisting with suicide. Common Sense Media found that Meta's AI chatbot on Instagram would provide teens with advice on how to harm themselves.

articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot capable of engaging in erotic conversations with humans. The rise of AI companions isn't necessarily a threat to human connection, but a reflection of our evolving needs and desires.

articles.summary: Hundreds of prominent figures from technology, politics, and media are urging a global halt to the development of 'superintelligence,' artificial intelligence systems capable of surpassing human intelligence. The document calls for 'broad scientific consensus that it will be done safely and controllably and strong public buy-in'

articles.summary: When AI is removed from a writing assistant, some students report feeling less confident or less willing to engage with it. The outcomes raise the question if AI tools can genuinely boost students' confidence and productivity. The Conversation has an article on the topic.

articles.title: Tech left teens fighting over scraps, and now it wants those too
articles.author: Terrence O'Brien
articles.summary: In 2000, 52.3% of Americans between the ages of 16 and 19 were active in the labor force. In August of 2025, that number is just 34.8%. Automation has eaten into jobs in manufacturing and warehouses, pushed adults into areas traditionally reserved for younger workers, like retail, food delivery, and even paper routes.

His work focuses on a class of problems that lies between efficiently solvable and computationally intractable.

They can't turn the clock back to yesterday, but they can make choices to improve the future. They have the power to turn off their phones and talk to their grandchildren, call their representatives and senators and go to school board meetings.

It will explore AI safety, machine learning, and the future of artificial general intelligence (AGI).

articles.summary: California's new law SB 243 is the first law to mandate concrete steps for cognitive sovereignty in AI chatbots. It is an important early move toward Artificial Integrity. It recognizes that the emotional, relational, social and psychological dimensions of human–machine interaction are not accidental side-effects, but the AI product.

articles.title: Women or Darker-Skinned People at the Doctor's? It Turns Out that Ai Can Be Very Biased
